citation.article-title: Mesorhizobium chacoense sp. nov., a novel species that nodulates Prosopis alba in the Chaco Arido region (Argentina).
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Mesorhizobium chacoense sp. nov.
Mesorhizobium chacoense (cha.co.en'se. N.L. neut. adj. chacoense from El Chaco, Argentina, where the type strain was isolated)
Colonies on YMA are circular, convex, white, opaque and usually 1-3 mm in diameter within 7 d at 28 °C.
The generation times are 10-24 h in YM broth.
Strains of this species produce acid from sucrose, galactose, lactose, L-arabinose, rhamnose, trehalose, maltose, adonitol and melibiose in media with ammonium nitrate as nitrogen source.
These strains are resistant to erythromycin, cipro¯oxacin and cloxacillin.
All strains produce β-xylosidases, α-maltosidases and N-acetylglucosaminidases.
This species shows the 5S rRNA zone in LMW RNA profiles typical of the genus Mesorhizobium.
All strains have the same tRNA profile.
The plasmid present in the strains did not carry the nifH gene.
The type strain,LMG19008T (=CECT 5336T), has the characteristics described for this species.
The G+­C content of genomic DNA of strains LMG 19008T and LMG 19022, as determined by HPLC, is 62 mol%.
